## IHttpErrorSerializer.serializerError property

Serializes an HttpError into a detailed object including the full error chain. This method is intended for logging and debugging purposes, as it includes sensitive information like stack traces and full error messages.

**Signature:**

```typescript
serializerError: (error: HttpError) => {
        topLevel: {
            name: string;
            message: string;
            code: unknown;
            logLevel: LogLevel;
            responseMessage: string;
            meta: {} | undefined;
            stack: string | undefined;
        };
        causeChain: Array<Record<string, any>>;
    };
```

## Example


```typescript
const serializer = new HttpErrorSerializer();
const detailedError = serializer.serializerError(httpError);
logger.error('HTTP error occurred', detailedError);
```
